qas.question: How many goals did Laszlo Kubala score in 256 matches?
What titles did Barcelona win in 1948 and 1949?
In what year did Barcelona begin the construction of a new stadium?
Who blessed the first stone of the new stadium?

context: After the construction was complete there was no further room for expansion at Les Corts. Back-to-back <a1_0>La Liga<a1_0/> titles in 1948 and 1949 and the signing of László Kubala in <a2_0>June 1950<a2_0/>, who would later go on to score <a0_0>196<a0_0/> goals in 256 matches, drew larger crowds to the games. The club began to make plans for a new stadium. The building of Camp Nou commenced on 28 March <a3_0>1954<a3_0/>, before a crowd of 60,000 Barça fans. The first stone of the future stadium was laid in place under the auspices of Governor Felipe Acedo Colunga and with the blessing of <a4_0>Archbishop of Barcelona Gregorio Modrego<a4_0/>. Construction took three years and ended on 24 September 1957 with a final cost of 288 million pesetas, 336% over budget.
